meanings.definition: Thin, flexible metal sheet used for wrapping food.
meanings.sent1: I wrapped my sandwich in tinfoil to keep it fresh.
meanings.sent2: Mom packed my lunch in tinfoil to keep it warm.
meanings.sent3: The tinfoil crinkled loudly as I wrapped the leftovers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like tinfoil, shiny and bright.
meanings.sent5: The tinfoil gleamed under the kitchen lights.

meanings.definition: To cover or wrap with tinfoil.
meanings.sent1: Please tinfoil the leftovers before putting them in the fridge.
meanings.sent2: I tinfoiled the dish before baking it in the oven.
meanings.sent3: He tinfoiled his head, pretending to be a robot.
meanings.sent4: The magician tinfoiled the rabbit, making it disappear.
meanings.sent5: She tinfoiled the gift box, adding a special touch.
